module.p: deich ten, 10 is a numeral.

Pedagogical examples –
Co mheud leabhar a tha agad an sin? / Tha deich leabhraochean agam.
How many books do you have there? / I have ten books. td. 221
deich a(i)r fhichead / ceithir fichead ’s a deich
thirty / ninety td. 221

Biblical examples –
A Nis is iad so ainmeanna chloinn Israeil, a thàinig do’n Eiphit; thàinig gach duine agus a theaghlach maille re Iacob: Reuben, Simeon, Lebhi, agus Iudah, [...] Agus na h-anman uile a thàinig a mach a leasraidh Iacoib, bu deich agus tri fichead anam iad; oir bha Ioseph ’san Eiphit a cheana. [...]
Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob. Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, [...] And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already. [KJV] Ecsodus I.1–5

Pedagogical examples –
Co mheud leabhar a tha agad an sin? / Tha a deich.
How many books do you have there? / I have ten. td. 221
air taobh-duilleig a deich
on page ten td. 221
deicheamh tenth, 10th is a derived ordinal, with suffix -(e)amh.

Pedagogical examples –
an deicheamh fear
the tenth man/one td. 221
ron deicheamh latha den Lùnastal
before the tenth (day) of August td. 221
Seall dhomh am boireannach a ghabhadh ris an deicheamh cuid dheth.
Show me the woman who would put up with the tenth [part] of it. td. 221
an deicheamh earrann
a tenth td. 221
deicheamh a tenth, a decimal, tithe is a derived masculine noun, with genitive singular deicheimh. Alternative spelling: deachamh.

Pedagogical examples –
deicheamh meatair
a tenth of a meter td. 221
deichnear ten people is a masculine numeric noun

Pedagogical examples –
deichnear mhac
ten sons td. 14
deichnear bhalach
ten boys td. 221
naoinear no deichnear de chaileagan
nine or ten girls td. 221
deug -teen, plus ten, +10 is a derived numeric adjective.
aon ... deug eleven, 11 is a compound numeral, formed from aon one, 1.

Pedagogical examples –
aon bhreac deug
eleven trout td. 226
a h-aon deug eleven, 11 is an absolute numeral form.
dà ... dheug twelve, 12 is a compound numeral, formed from dà two, 2.

Pedagogical examples –
dà bhreac dheug
twelve trout td. 226

Examples from Gairm –
Ann an dà bhliadhna dheug sgrìobh e fichead leabhar ’s a h-aon ’s dh’ fhàg e grunn mór phàipearan a chùl air a sin.
In 12 years he [Kierkegaard] wrote 21 books and he left behind a large quantity of papers. td. 103
a dhà dheug twelve, 12 is an absolute numeral form.
trì ... deug thirteen, 13 is a compound numeral, formed from trì three, 3.

Pedagogical examples –
trì bric dheug
thirteen trout td. 226
a trì deug thirteen, 13 is an absolute numeral form.
ceithir ... deug fourteen, 14 is a compound numeral, formed from ceithir four, 4.

Pedagogical examples –
ceithir bric dheug
fourteen trout td. 226
a ceithir deug fourteen, 14 is an absolute numeral form.
còig ... deug fifteen, 15 is a compound numeral, formed from còig five, 5.

Pedagogical examples –
còig bric dheug
fifteen trout td. 226
a còig deug fifteen, 15 is an absolute numeral form.
sia ... deug sixteen, 16 is a compound numeral, formed from sia six, 6.

Pedagogical examples –
sia bric dheug
sixteen trout td. 226
a sia deug sixteen, 16 is an absolute numeral form.
seachd ... deug seventeen, 17 is a compound numeral, formed from seachd seven, 7.

Pedagogical examples –
seachd bric dheug
seventeen trout td. 226
a seachd deug seventeen, 17 is an absolute numeral form.
ochd ... deug eighteen, 18 is a compound numeral, formed from ochd eight, 8.

Pedagogical examples –
ochd bric dheug
eighteen trout td. 226
a h-ochd deug eighteen, 18 is an absolute numeral form.
naoi ... deug nineteen, 19 is a compound numeral, formed from naoi nine, 9.

Pedagogical examples –
naoi bric dheug
nineteen trout td. 226
a naoi deug nineteen, 19 is an absolute numeral form.
deugaire teenager is a masculine anthropic common noun, with plural form deugairean.
deugan teens is a derived plural common noun.
deugaich go into one’s teens, become more than ten is a derived verb, with suffix -(a)ich. The verbal noun is deugachadh
deugachadh going into one’s teens, becoming more than ten, tens is a derived masculine common noun, with genitive singular deugachaidh.

Pedagogical examples –
an dèidh deugachadh a dh’uairean a thìde
after tens of hours [of time] td. 226
Bha deugachadh dhaoine againn aig a’ choinneimh.
We had tens of people at the meeting. td. 226
deich a ten is a derived masculine noun, with plural form deichean.

Pedagogical examples –
deichean agus aonadan
tens and units td. 221
Tha ar figearan a’ dol nan deichean.
Our figures work in [their] tens. td. 221
Seo bonn leth-cheud agus an còrr [ann] an deichean.
Here’s a fifty pence piece and the rest in tens. td. 221
anns na deichean air fhichead
in the thirties, in the 30s td. 221
deichead decade, ten years, decimal is a masculine derived common noun, with genitive singular deicheid and plural deicheadan.

Pedagogical examples –
anns na deicheadan roimhe seo
in the preceding decades td. 221
san deichead a tha romhainn
in the decade before us td. 221
deicheach decimal is a derived adjective, with suffix -(e)ach.

Pedagogical examples –
cùnntas deicheach / riochd deicheach / bloigh dheicheach / comharrachadh deicheach / ionad deicheach
decimal counting / decimal form / decimal fraction / decimal notation / decimal place td. 221
deicheil decimal is a derived adjective, with suffix -(a)il.
deich-bhliadhnail decennial, every ten years is a derived adjective, with suffix -(a)il. cf. bliadhna fem. year.
